info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 27 at 4:08AM EDT until May 27 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Transylvania County, North Carolina * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding along the French Broad River from Rosman to Brevard and along the Davidson River near Pisgah Forest, will continue for at least the next several hours, impacting common, flood-prone roadways, boat access areas, farmland, and other areas adjacent to streams. Floodwaters are currently impacting residential areas adjacent to the French Broad River in Rosman. Additional, nuisance flooding will continue to expand along the Little River near Penrose as well through later this morning before conditions stabilize and slowly start to improve Friday afternoon. * The French Broad River at Rosman exceeded the Minor Flood Stage of 9.0 feet at 1am this morning. The current stage is 11.26 feet and rising slowly. The river is expected to continue to rise to near 11.5 feet over the next 1-2 hours before cresting. Since no additional rainfall is expected, confidence in this crest is high. Expect the river to fall back below Minor Flood Stage by early this afternoon. At these levels, floodwaters will be approaching the crawl spaces of the homes along Depot St and may begin inundating US 176 just downstream of the gauge site. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 358 AM EDT, Heavy rain has ended across Transylvania County and high water and flooding conditions will gradually improve later this morning into early this afternoon. It will take most of Friday for the larger streams to crest and recede back below bankfull levels so this Flood Warning will continue through Friday evening or until streams no longer pose a flooding threat. No additional rainfall is expected for the next several days. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brevard, Rosman, Gorges State Park, Dupont State Forest, Balsam Grove, Connestee, Wolf Mountain, Sapphire, Penrose, Cedar Mountain, Little River In Transylvania County and North Transylvania.
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
